sections.title: What is a Trajectory?
sections.content: A trajectory is a planned path that your robot follows, defined by a series of positions and headings. Trajectories allow for smooth, precise, and repeatable movement, which is essential for advanced autonomous routines.

sections.title: Why Use Trajectories?
sections.content: Using trajectories lets your robot move along complex paths, not just straight lines or simple turns. This is especially useful for tasks like navigating around obstacles or following game-specific routes.

sections.content: The TrajectoryBuilder class lets you create more complex paths, including curves and turns. You can chain together different movement commands to build the exact path you need.
